work.title: La Nuit et l’Amour

composer.name: Augusta Holmès
composer.longDescription: Augusta Holmès was a bold and revolutionary French composer known for her large-scale works and patriotic themes. She defied gender expectations in 19th-century France, composing for orchestras and writing revolutionary hymns. Her late work, 'La Nuit et l’Amour', distills Romantic passion into a compact symphonic poem, offering a striking statement of artistic freedom and emotional expression.
composer.shortDescription: French composer known for revolutionary themes and rich orchestral writing.

work.shortDescription: A lush and dramatic miniature blending Romantic lyricism with a spirit of defiance.
work.longDescription: La Nuit et l’Amour is a late symphonic poem by Augusta Holmès, composed in 1902. Despite its brevity, the piece carries deep emotional and political undercurrents. Its lush textures and bold gestures suggest a personal protest through art — a declaration of female artistic voice in a male-dominated world. The work showcases Holmès’s ability to condense Romantic intensity into a compact form that feels both intimate and theatrical.
work.rawContent:
ORCHESTRAL · SYMPHONIC POEM

~5 MINUTES

Instrumentation Summary

Flute, Oboe, Clarinet, Bassoon, Horn, Trumpet, Trombone, Tuba, Timpani, Percussion, Strings

Mood and Style

Dramatic · Bold · Lush

insight: Though wrapped in Romantic language, this miniature symphonic poem pulses with personal and political undercurrent. Written by a trailblazing woman who refused to stay silent, La Nuit et l’Amour becomes a statement of artistic freedom and emotional revolution.

work.title: Machine

composer.name: Jennifer Higdon
composer.longDescription: Jennifer Higdon is a Pulitzer Prize-winning American composer whose music is known for its rhythmic drive, coloristic orchestration, and emotional directness. She is one of the most performed living composers in the U.S., and her works span symphonic, chamber, and choral forms. *Machine* captures her signature energy and vivid sound palette in a compact, dynamic fanfare.
composer.shortDescription: Pulitzer Prize-winning American composer known for vivid orchestration and rhythmic energy.

work.shortDescription: An explosive miniature capturing the energy and danger of mechanical power.
work.longDescription: Written as a high-octane opener, *Machine* is a tightly wound orchestral fanfare that clanks, whirrs, and powers forward with relentless energy. Its compact form creates a vivid soundscape of industrial force and social motion. Though abstract, it evokes themes of innovation and resistance, making it a powerful programming tool.
work.rawContent:
ORCHESTRAL · CONCERT OPENER / FANFARE

~3 MINUTES

Instrumentation Summary

Flute, Oboe, Clarinet, Bassoon, Horn, Trumpet, Trombone, Tuba, Percussion, Piano, Strings

Mood and Style

Mechanical · Energetic · Relentless

insight: An explosive miniature built on momentum and drive. Machine captures the raw energy of industrial power — making it a bold and symbolic opener for themes of progress, resistance, and the human cost of forward motion.

work.title: con forza

composer.name: Unsuk Chin
composer.longDescription: Unsuk Chin is a South Korean-born composer based in Berlin, known for her experimental and highly individual voice. Her music often combines rigorous structure with imaginative textures and fearless innovation. *con forza*, composed in 2020, is a sonic rebellion written for Beethoven’s 250th anniversary — more deconstruction than homage.
composer.shortDescription: Berlin-based Korean composer known for bold, experimental orchestral works.

work.shortDescription: A fierce sonic collage that dismantles tradition and dares to disrupt.
work.longDescription: *con forza* is an experimental orchestral collage written for Beethoven Year 2020. Rather than celebrate, Chin deconstructs — creating glitchy textures and aggressive rhythms that interrogate the legacy of classical music. A sharp, defiant musical act full of fragmentation and resistance.
work.rawContent:
ORCHESTRAL · EXPERIMENTAL FANFARE

~5 MINUTES

Instrumentation Summary

Winds, Brass, Strings, Piano, Percussion (including extended techniques)

Mood and Style

Fierce · Fragmented · Defiant

insight: Written for Beethoven’s 250th anniversary, con forza smashes, twists, and reimagines tradition. It’s a sonic rebellion — a furious musical collage that interrogates power, heritage, and noise.
